010package imagingbook.pub.color.image;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.color.image.Illuminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.pub.color.image.Illuminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017
018/**
019 * This class implements the CIELab color space.
020 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
021 * coordinates, i.e., without conversion to Java's D50-based profile 
022 * connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ 
023 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space.
024 * 
025 * @author W. Burger
026 * @version 2022/01/28
027 */
028@SuppressWarnings("serial")
029public class LabColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
030
031        // D65 reference white point:
032        private static final double Xref = D65.getX();  // 0.950456
033        private static final double Yref = D65.getY();  // 1.000000
034        private static final double Zref = D65.getZ();  // 1.088754
035
036        // chromatic adaptation objects:
037        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = new BradfordAdaptation(D65, D50);
038        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = new BradfordAdaptation(D50, D65);
039
040        // the only constructor:
041        public LabColorSpace() {
042                super(TYPE_Lab, 3);
043        }
044
045        // XYZ50->CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D50)
046        @Override
047        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
048                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);     
049                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
050        }
051
052        // XYZ65->CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D65)
053        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {
054                double xx = f1(XYZ65[0] / Xref);        
055                double yy = f1(XYZ65[1] / Yref);
056                double zz = f1(XYZ65[2] / Zref);
057                float L = (float)(116.0 * yy - 16.0);
058                float a = (float)(500.0 * (xx - yy));
059                float b = (float)(200.0 * (yy - zz));
060                return new float[] {L, a, b};
061        }
062
063        // CIELab->XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Lab
064        @Override
065        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Lab) {
066                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
067                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
068        }
069
070        // CIELab->XYZ65: returns XYZ values (relative to D65) from Lab
071        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Lab) {
072                double ll = ( Lab[0] + 16.0 ) / 116.0;
073                float Y65 = (float) (Yref * f2(ll));
074                float X65 = (float) (Xref * f2(ll + Lab[1] / 500.0));
075                float Z65 = (float) (Zref * f2(ll - Lab[2] / 200.0));
076                return new float[] {X65, Y65, Z65};
077        }
078
079        //sRGB->CIELab (direct, without adaptation to D50)
080        @Override
081        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
082                // get linear rgb components:
083                double r = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[0]);
084                double g = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[1]);
085                double b = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[2]);
086
087                // convert to XYZ (D65-based, Poynton/ITU709) 
088                float X = (float) (0.412453 * r + 0.357580 * g + 0.180423 * b);
089                float Y = (float) (0.212671 * r + 0.715160 * g + 0.072169 * b);
090                float Z = (float) (0.019334 * r + 0.119193 * g + 0.950227 * b);
091
092                float[] XYZ65 = new float[] {X, Y, Z}; 
093                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
094        }
095
096        //CIELab->sRGB (direct, without adaptation to D50)
097        @Override
098        public float[] toRGB(float[] Lab) {
099                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
100                double X = XYZ65[0];
101                double Y = XYZ65[1];
102                double Z = XYZ65[2];
103                // XYZ -> RGB (linear components)
104                double r = (3.240479 * X + -1.537150 * Y + -0.498535 * Z);
105                double g = (-0.969256 * X + 1.875992 * Y + 0.041556 * Z);
106                double b = (0.055648 * X + -0.204043 * Y + 1.057311 * Z);
107
108                // RGB -> sRGB (nonlinear components)
109                float rr = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(r);
110                float gg = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(g);
111                float bb = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(b);
112
113                return new float[] {rr,gg,bb} ; //sRGBcs.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
114        }
115
116        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
117
118        private static final double epsilon = 216.0/24389;
119        private static final double kappa = 841.0/108;
120
121        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
122        private double f1 (double c) {
123                if (c > epsilon) // 0.008856
124                        return Math.cbrt(c);
125                else
126                        return (kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
127        }
128
129        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
130        private double f2 (double c) {
131                double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
132                if (c3 > epsilon)
133                        return c3;
134                else
135                        return (c - 16.0 / 116) / kappa;
136        }
137
138        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
139
140        // moved to tests:
141//      public static void main(String[] args) {        // TODO: move to tests
142//              int sr = 128;
143//              int sg = 1;
144//              int sb = 128;
145//              System.out.format("Input (sRGB) = %d, %d, %d\n", sr, sg, sb);
146//              System.out.format("XYZref = %10g, %10g, %10g\n", Xref,Yref,Zref);
147//
148//              ColorSpace cs = new LabColorSpace();
149//              //float[] luv = cs.fromCIEXYZ(new float[] {.1f,.5f,.9f});
150//              float[] lab = cs.fromRGB(new float[] {sr/255f, sg/255f, sb/255f});
151//
152//              System.out.format("Lab = %8f, %8f, %8f\n", lab[0],lab[2],lab[2]);
153//              //float[] xyz = cs.toCIEXYZ(luv);
154//              float[] srgb = cs.toRGB(lab);
155//              System.out.format("sRGB = %8f, %8f, %8f\n", 
156//                              Math.rint(255*srgb[0]), Math.rint(255*srgb[1]), Math.rint(255*srgb[2]));
157//      }
158}
